answers.answer: I had no idea I was at a routine visit and told to go straight to the hospital, I'd had a rough pregnancy and had overlooked things now that I wouldn't have if it had been more predictable. Thankfully I had my dd the next day

I had severe swelling in my hands, feet and neck. Routine check showed the normal "trace" amount of protein which did not concern doctors at the time. I started getting black spots in my vision on/off and unbearable back pain. I decided to go in to the hospital one day, the back pain was so bad and they determined I had severe preeclampsia with hello syndrome. A double kidney infection was the cause of the back pain, beginning stage of liver failure, low blood platelets.. They literally took me right in for surgery to have her delivered..
I went directly to the hospital and was induced that with my last pregnancy
I Wuz 37 Weeks Pregnant And I Went In For My Routine Checkup And I Had A NST (Non Stress Test) I Had Protein In My Urine And My Pressure Wuz Up So I Wuz Sent To L&D Where I Got Induced

Thank you for your responses. I called my ob because of swelling and headaches. They did find proteins in my urine and said i had preeclampsia. My blood pressure is pretty high but they ultimately just sent me home and put me on bed rest. I asked if there is anything i should be looking out for because im almost 36w, and all he said was headaches and that they would tell me if i needed to worry. I guess i should just trust my ob but it is making me panic.

question: How did u know that u were in need of treatment? Were u at a routine checkup or did u have symptoms that concerned u and u called the doc? I just really wanna know the warning signs. So any info will help.
title: ladies that have been hospitalized for preeclampsia
